steps.title: A chakra is a wheel or circle of energy.
steps.content: A chakra is a wheel or circle of energy. It’s believed that we have seven chakras in our body—seven energy points that combine to make our life force. The energy chakras wield is called prana and is the essence of our energetic souls. Prana travels through the body from chakra to chakra, affecting emotional and physical well-being. If there is negative energy in the body, the flow of prana can be interrupted—putting you and your chakras off balance. [1] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source A healthy mind, body, and soul connection will have aligned and balanced chakras with a steady flow of prana.

steps.title: The Root Chakra (Muladhara) is located at the base of the spine.
steps.content: The Root Chakra (Muladhara) is located at the base of the spine. This chakra symbolizes grounding and connection with the earth, the Root Chakra is what centers you. Imagine you’re a tree, and your feet and legs are your roots. Where and how you spread your roots is the essence of your Root Chakra. If you’re feeling uncertain or unsteady, this chakra may be blocked. Foundation: Basic trust Signs of alignment: Groundedness, ease, and stability Signs of blockage: Fear, instability, and anxiety Color: Red [2] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Element: Earth Gland: Adrenal Yoga pose: Mountain Pose Affirmation: “I am.” [3] X Research source Crystals: Ruby, Garnet, & Red Jasper

steps.title: The Sacral Chakra (Swadhisthana) is just below your belly button.
steps.content: The Sacral Chakra (Swadhisthana) is just below your belly button. Representing pleasure and sexual development, the Sacral Chakra balances your relationships with others. Your emotions are central to this chakra, so ask yourself if you’re feeling in control of your life. If the answer is “no,” your Sacral Chakra may be blocked. Foundation: Creativity and sexuality Signs of alignment: Passion, openness, creativity, and fulfillment Signs of blockage: Uninspired, low libido, isolation, and guilt Color: Orange Element: Water Gland: Gonads Yoga pose: Knee-to-Chest [4] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Affirmation: “I feel.” Crystals: Carnelian, Orange Sapphire, & Imperial Topaz

steps.title: The Solar Plexus Chakra (Manipura) sits right above the navel.
steps.content: The Solar Plexus Chakra (Manipura) sits right above the navel. Courage, fear, and anxiety are the essence of the Solar Plexus Chakra’s prana . The more confident you are, the more aligned your Solar Plexus is. When self-doubt starts to creep in, your energy could be blocked. [5] X Research source Foundation: Wisdom and power [6] X Research source Signs of alignment: Confidence, drive, and ambition Signs of blockage: Low self-esteem, indecisiveness, and shame Color: Yellow Element: Fire Gland: Pancreas Yoga pose: Spinal Twist Affirmation: “I can.” Crystals: Citrine, Yellow Sapphire, & Amber

steps.title: The Heart Chakra (Anahata) is in the center of your chest.
steps.content: The Heart Chakra (Anahata) is in the center of your chest. As the name suggests, the Heart Chakra is all about love and compassion. Your care for others and yourself is the core of this chakra. A sign of a blocked Heart Chakra could be having trouble giving and receiving love. Foundation: Love and healing Signs of alignment: Peace, compassion, forgiveness [7] X Research source Signs of blockage: Grief, intolerance, and hatred Color: Green Element: Air Gland: Thymus Yoga pose: Fan Pose Affirmation: “I love.” Crystals: Jade, Rose Quartz, & Emerald

steps.title: The Throat Chakra (Vishuddha) is located in your throat.
steps.content: The Throat Chakra (Vishuddha) is located in your throat. This chakra’s prana influences the way you communicate with yourself and others. Think of this chakra like your voice box. If your thoughts and voice aren’t connecting, the Throat Chakra may be blocked. Foundation: Communication Signs of alignment: Truth and good listening skills [8] X Research source Signs of blockage: Secretive and dishonesty Color: Blue Element: Space Gland: Thyroid Yoga pose: Neck stretch Affirmation: “I speak.” Crystals: Turquoise, Aquamarine, & Blue Topaz

steps.title: The Third-Eye Chakra (Anja) rests between your brows.
steps.content: The Third-Eye Chakra (Anja) rests between your brows. When you hear the phrase “third-eye,” you may think of Greek mythology’s cyclops. Imagine another eye resting between your own, just like a cyclops; this is your Third-Eye Chakra. The Third-Eye Chakra is precisely that, a third eye waiting to be opened. This chakra helps you see the bigger picture and represents your soul. A sign that this chakra may be blocked is having trouble connecting with your intuition. Foundation: Awareness Signs of alignment: Intuition, creativity, and clarity Signs of blockage: Poor judgment and illusions [9] X Research source Color: Indigo Element: Light or Darkness Gland: Pineal Yoga pose: The Gaze Affirmation: “I see.” Crystals: Lapis Lazuli, Sapphire, & Tanzanite

steps.title: The Crown Chakra (Sahasrara) sits on the top of your head.
steps.content: The Crown Chakra (Sahasrara) sits on the top of your head. As the name suggests, the Crown Chakra is your spiritual crown. It represents your connection with yourself and the spiritual world. This chakra may be blocked if you are experiencing brain fog or a disconnect with your mind, body, or spirit. Foundation: Spirituality Signs of alignment: Faith, wisdom, and understanding Signs of blockage: Depression, anxiety, and disconnection Color: Purple Element: Divine Consciousness Gland: Pituitary Yoga pose: Modified Downward Dog Affirmation: “I know.” Crystals: Amethyst, Quartz, & Diamond

steps.title: Take time out of your day to relax.
steps.content: Take time out of your day to relax. Sometimes life gets the best of us. It’s all hustle and bustle, and it can be easy to forget about protecting ourselves. If things start to get overwhelming, take a step back and do something else. Give yourself space to focus on things you enjoy to realign your energy. [10] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Having a nice meal, walking your dog, or taking a nap are all ways you can relax.

steps.title: Reconnect with nature.
steps.content: Reconnect with nature. Your energy comes from the world around you, and spending time in nature can help heal chakra imbalances. Unplug and go for a walk, or grab a good book and sit outside to read. Each chakra gravitates toward an element, so give your body and soul some love following this guide: [11] X Research source The Root Chakra element is earth. Sit down in the grass and feel the presence of nature around you, paying close attention to sounds, smells, and textures. The Sacral Chakra element is water. Take a walk along the beach, or find tranquility next to a trickling creek. The Solar Plexus Chakra element is fire. Bask in the sun, or put together a campfire and make s'mores. The Heart Chakra element is air. Feel the breeze as you take a nature walk. The Throat Chakra element is ether. Take in the beauty of a clear blue sky by lying down on your back and looking up. The Third-Eye Chakra element is light. Lay out in the sun, or simply gaze up at its warmth. The Crown Chakra element is inner-light. Go stargazing on a clear night, or meditate outside in the sun.

steps.title: Start a daily yoga practice.
steps.content: Start a daily yoga practice. Yoga is a great way to learn physical balance while balancing the chakras. Start with short 10 minute flows for beginners, and then work your way up to 30+ minute flows. The time spent on your mat doesn’t matter, as long as you show up each day to fuel your prana . [12] X Research source See if there’s a local yoga studio near you. Going to regular classes can help you realign your chakras and make new friends. Yoga with Adriene, Yoga with Kassandra, and Yoga with Bird are popular YouTube channels that offer free practices for all levels. They even have yoga calendars to help you find a new practice each day.

steps.title: Try breathing exercises.
steps.content: Try breathing exercises. Box breathing is a great way to align your chakras and destress. Sit with your legs crossed in a quiet spot with your hands resting on your knees. Close your eyes and take a deep breath in for a count of four, feeling your stomach fill with air. Hold your breath for four more counts, and then exhale for four. Repeat this two more times before opening your eyes. [13] X Research source Imagine your root chakra spinning or opening up like a lotus flower. Feel its prana warm you until you’re very hot. Follow the prana up to your next chakra, the sacral chakra, and imagine it spinning, blooming, and warming. Continue this pattern of visualizing and breathing until you reach your crown chakra.

steps.title: Practice visualization with meditation.
steps.content: Practice visualization with meditation. Anxiety and stress could be the reason your chakras are blocked. Meditation is a great mindful tool you can use to calm your mind, body, and spirit. Find a quiet spot to settle down. This can be outdoors or indoors, whichever you prefer. Close your eyes and take a deep breath in, letting your body relax. Focus on the misaligned chakra. Imagine the energy around it glowing, and visualize it shifting back into position. [14] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source If your mind wanders away from your visualization while you're meditating, that’s okay! Meditation takes practice. Refocus and try again.

steps.title: Surround yourself with chakra colors.
steps.content: Surround yourself with chakra colors. Color therapy is an easy and fun way to align your chakras. Wear clothes that match a blocked chakra, eat food of that color, or watch color hypnosis videos. Surrounding yourself with a chakra’s color can help you focus on a particular chakra as you become more aware of your needs. Just make sure you focus on what color at a time. [15] X Research source Root Chakra: Red Sacral Chakra: Orange Solar Plexus Chakra: Yellow Heart Chakra: Green Throat Chakra: Blue Third-Eye Chakra: Indigo Crown Chakra: Purple

steps.title: Consider making changes to your diet.
steps.content: Consider making changes to your diet. What you put into your body can have a big impact on your emotional and physical well-being. Foods that are rich in nutrients and correlate with a chakra’s color can help bring balance to the body. Here are some foods you can eat when a chakra is imbalanced: Root Chakra: Tomatoes, strawberries, cherries, and root vegetables. Sacral Chakra: Oranges, peaches, carrots, and sweet potatoes. Solar Plexus Chakra: Bananas, eggs, pineapple, and garlic. Heart Chakra: Broccoli, green apples, kiwi, and dark chocolate. Throat Chakra: Blueberries, blackberries, and blue corn. Third-Eye Chakra: Eggplant, grapes, plums, and purple cabbage. Crown Chakra: Mushrooms, coconut, ginger, and onion.

steps.content: Heal your energy with crystals. Crystals store and spread energy and can be used to help align chakras. Placing crystals on your body on top of your chakras can help cleanse your spirit and redirect prana , creating balance. steps.title: Try sound healing.
steps.content: Try sound healing. Each chakra’s prana vibrates to a specific frequency, and sound healing uses these frequencies to harmonize the mind, body, and spirit. Tuning forks, gongs, crystal singing bowls, crystal pyramids, musical instruments, and voice can be used to realign the chakras as long as the right frequency or musical note is hit.
